title: Standard & Poor's Settles In SEC Ratings Fraud Case
teaser: Standard & Poor's has agreed to pay fines of nearly $80 million to settle charges that it changed the way it was rating securities in a bid to win business, but didn't bother to tell investors. The firm also agreed to a one year ban on rating certain kinds of securities.  A separate Justice Department investigation is still underway.
